consensus_mechanisms.title: MonadBFT Production Deployment
consensus_mechanisms.description: MonadBFT achieves 10,000+ tx/s with sub-second finality (800ms for 2 slots). Features linear communication complexity vs traditional quadratic BFT, tail-forking resistance via timeout certificates and reproposal mechanism. Production ready with pipelined processing enabling speculative finality in 1 round.

consensus_mechanisms.title: Proof of Stake Institutional Migration Impact
consensus_mechanisms.description: Institutional treasuries increasingly earning on-chain income through PoS staking on Ethereum/Solana. Expected to compress yields as institutional capital grows through 2026. Unbonding periods becoming critical factor (21 days Cosmos, variable Ethereum withdrawal queue).

execution_layers.title: Ethereum L1-zkEVM Roadmap 2026 Acceleration
execution_layers.description: EIP-8025 Optional Execution Proofs enable zkAttester mode for validators. Six parallel workstreams active by EF zkEVM team. Glamsterdam hard fork mid-2026 for proving windows. zkVM proofs targeting ~300KB. Fundamental shift from re-execution to proof verification at L1.

execution_layers.title: Parallel Execution ZKVM Architecture
execution_layers.description: First zkVM implementations based on parallel execution architecture. Stellar Slingshot zkVM achieves 1-2ms verification per CPU core with high parallelization. QuBit developing RISC-V based zkEVM for institutional-grade finance with decoupled execution/verification.

state_management.title: Ethereum Hegota Verkle Trees + State Expiry
state_management.description: Vitalik's roadmap implements Period 1 fork with hexary Patricia tree frozen and new Verkle tree for edits. Period 2 implements full state expiry with ~20-50GB flat state size. EIP-7736 proposes leaf-level state expiry in Verkle trees. Two-period storage model (~2 years archival).

state_management.title: A3Verkle Trie Active Account Optimization
state_management.description: New blockchain world state organization targeting active accounts using Verkle Trie structure. Addresses varying impact of different account behaviors on data growth. Published in ScienceDirect September 2025.

data_availability.title: Data Availability Sampling Production Status
data_availability.description: Ethereum Fusaka upgrade (Dec 3, 2025) shipped PeerDAS, increasing blob capacity from 3 to 6-9 per block. Validator data sampling now active with significant L2 fee reductions observed. Erasure coding + DAS combination providing security guarantees.

data_availability.title: Comprehensive DAS Security Analysis
data_availability.description: arXiv paper (July 2024) provides comprehensive simulation study of Ethereum's DAS design. Sublinear sampling with erasure coding enables verification with high probability even with partial data views. Critical for data sharding environments.

client_architecture.title: Modular vs Monolithic Architecture Dominance
client_architecture.description: Data Availability as critical bottleneck for 2026 scaling. Modular setups with dedicated DA layers (Celestia, EIP-4844) enabling significantly higher TPS while preserving decentralization. Base moving from OP Stack to unified architecture while maintaining client diversity.

client_architecture.title: Solana Firedancer Production Readiness
client_architecture.description: C implementation achieving 1M+ TPS in testing. 30% mainnet stake support (300+ validators). FireBAM oracle-based block engine in testing. Tile-based architecture for bug isolation. Full production release 2026. Frankendancer hybrid already deployed.

mev_transaction_ordering.title: Flashnet Network-Anonymized Mempools
mev_transaction_ordering.description: Revolutionary anonymous broadcast protocol achieving lower latency than TOR/Nym. TEE-based liveness with cryptographic anonymity. Complements BuilderNet for permissionless block building. Supports account abstraction mempools. Event horizon for distributed block building.

mev_transaction_ordering.title: FOCIL Implementation for Hegota
mev_transaction_ordering.description: Fork-Choice Enforced Inclusion Lists advancing for Hegota upgrade. EIP-7805 specification active with Thomas Thiery as architect. 8KB list size cap with expansion pathways. Decentralized validators enforce transaction inclusion against builder centralization.

mev_transaction_ordering.title: Encrypted Mempool EIP Ecosystem
mev_transaction_ordering.description: EIP-8105 Universal Enshrined Encrypted Mempool from Shutter. Threshold encrypted mempools with mev-commit preconfirmations. Integration with FOCIL and ePBS for comprehensive protection. Builders can simulate plaintext sections while appending encrypted transactions.

interoperability.title: Universal Cross-Chain Standards Emergence
interoperability.description: Universal standards expected in 2026 enabling any blockchain to communicate with any other. Focus on shared security models and communication protocols across diverse architectures. Intent-based architectures where users express intents without specifying paths.

interoperability.title: Cross-Chain Bridge Architecture Evolution
interoperability.description: Move beyond simple token bridges to cross-chain messaging and governance tooling. Synapse eliminating wrapped asset complexity. Comprehensive survey shows LayerZero Omnichain, Multichain expansion. ScienceDirect analysis of bridge architectural flaws and mitigations.

high_delta_findings.title: Ethereum Hegota Verkle Trees + State Expiry

medium_delta_findings.title: Proof of Stake Institutional Migration Impact

watchlist_items.reason: Critical path for L1-zkEVM proving windows implementation
Alpenglow consensus protocol with 80x finality improvement
Integration with Flashnet for permissionless block building
Simpler non-exhaustive approach to state expiry in Verkle trees
User intent expression without path specification via solvers
